Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: This guide helps resolve common lab access issues in the PCTE environment. Follow these steps to diagnose and fix access problems.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Can't see lab in portal? → Check enrollment status. Lab shows but won't launch? → Verify browser compatibility. Lab crashes after launch? → Check system requirements. Permission denied error? → Contact administrator

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Log into the Training Portal with your PCTE credentials. Navigate to My Profile → Account Status. Verify your account shows as Active. Check that your role includes Lab Access permission. If locked, wait 15 minutes or contact Help Desk.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Go to Training Portal → Available Labs. Verify the lab you want to access is listed. Check the lab status indicator (green = available). Look for maintenance windows in the announcements. If lab is unavailable, try an alternative module.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Supported: Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Edge 90+. Not supported: Internet Explorer, Safari on Windows. Clear browser cache: Ctrl+Shift+Delete. Disable extensions: Try incognito/private mode. Enable JavaScript and WebSockets.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: On-site: Ensure you're on PCTE network. Remote: Verify VPN connection to PCTE. Check VPN client version (must be 2.3+). Verify firewall allows ports: 443, 8080, 8443. Test connectivity: ping lab.pcte.mil

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Confirm you've completed prerequisite modules. Verify you're enrolled in the correct training course. Check module completion status in dashboard. For advanced modules, verify instructor approval.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Cause: Role doesn't include lab access. Solution: Contact training administrator to update role.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Cause: Lab is down for maintenance. Solution: Check announcements or try different lab.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Cause: Incorrect module ID or not enrolled. Solution: Verify module number and enrollment status.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Cause: Network connectivity issue. Solution: Check VPN, firewall, and network connection.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Cause: Using unsupported browser. Solution: Switch to Chrome, Firefox, or Edge.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Clear all browser data. Try different network. Check system resources (4GB+ RAM, 2GB free disk). Verify SSO status at sso.pcte.mil.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: Response time: 2 hours during business hours. Ticket priority: High. Include: Lab module number, Error message, Browser/OS version, Steps already tried.

Title: Lab Access Troubleshooting Guide
Content: KB-DEMO-002: Password Reset Guide, KB-DEMO-003: Training Portal Access, KB-DEMO-004: VPN Configuration
